summary: Fix skills progress bar animation flicker by eliminating race condition between JavaScript timeout and CSS transitions. The issue occurs because the 300ms timeout in animateSkillBar() creates timing conflicts with the 1-second CSS transition, causing bars to flicker and move backwards before completing their animation.

action_plan.description: Set explicit initial width state for skill progress bars before animation begins
Remove the problematic 300ms timeout from animateSkillBar() function
Ensure proper initial state by setting width to 0% immediately when skill items are created
Add requestAnimationFrame to ensure DOM is ready before triggering width animation
Test the animation by scrolling to skills section and verifying smooth progress bar animation

risks: Animation timing changes might affect other scroll-triggered animations
Browser compatibility issues with requestAnimationFrame timing
CSS transition duration might need adjustment for optimal visual effect
issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
